summary: Rage Against the Machine was an American rock band formed in 1991 in Los Angeles. The band, known for blending heavy metal, rap, punk, and funk with political lyrics, consisted of Zack de la Rocha (vocals), Tim Commerford (bass), Tom Morello (guitar), and Brad Wilk (drums). They sold over 16 million records and were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2023. Their self-titled debut album was a hit, followed by successful albums like "Evil Empire" and "The Battle of Los Angeles." The band broke up in 2000 but reunited a few times before disbanding again in 2024.
title: Rage Against the Machine
